pages.text: An essential item to control any aspect of a turret.$(br)Pointing at a turret whilst holding this will show you some basic stats of the turret.$(br2)Right-click a turret with it will show you an UI for turret configuration.$(br)Certain upgrades may add pages, explained in the respective upgrade entry.
The next pages explain the tab pages of the UI

pages.title: Turret Info
pages.text: This tab will show you general information (a POV camera, turret name (editable), etc.). $(italic)Hovering over the icon on the left shows you what it is.$()$(br2)At the bottom are control buttons to dismantle the turret (requires a $(l:misc/turret_crate)Turret Crate$(/l)),$(br)de-/activate it as well as toggle a display showing its range.
$(italic)An example of the info page for a $(l:turrets/crossbow)Crossbow Turret$(/l) inside a forest$(/italic)

pages.title: Entity Target Settings
pages.text: Here you can configure which types of entities the turret can target by either individually selecting entries in the list or selecting groups of entities (all or none; monsters, animals, other)$(br2)It also features a Blacklist/Whitelist mode. The default is a whitelist.
$(italic)The target page with only 2 entities selected, in whitelist mode$(/italic)

pages.title: Player Target Settings
pages.text: Just like in the Entity Target Settings tab, you can configure which players can be targeted by the turret, including yourself!$(br2)It also features a Blacklist/Whitelist mode. The default is a whitelist.
$(italic)The target page with no players selected, in whitelist mode$(/italic)

pages.title: Upgrades
pages.text: Add or remove upgrades with ease here, similar to a chest.$(br2)Greyed out slots are locked and you'll need the $(l:upgrades/upgrade_storage)Upgrade Storage upgrades$() in order to unlock them.
$(italic)The upgrades page with some upgrades applied$(/italic)

pages.title: Remote Access
pages.text: The TCU is capable of being bound to a specific turret. To do so you need to right-click a turret with the TCU whilst sneaking. Once that is done, you can access the TCU UI without being close to that turret. The only caveat is that you need $(l:upgrades/remote_access)an upgrade$(/l) in order to dismantle, manage upgrades or anything else involving item transfer.$(br)To unbind a bound TCU, just right-click it whilst sneaking, not pointing to a turret.
When holding a bound TCU, the turret is highlighted while the TCU is in your hands.
